description.narrative: Emerging Markets Communications (EMC or the Company) provides mission-critical, end-to-end communications solutions to governments, non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and multinational corporations operating in remote regions of the globe. Specifically, the Companys services include voice, data, email, video and broadband internet access and applications. The project consists of (i) the scaling up and expansion, and (ii) the balance sheet strengthening, of EMCs VSAT telecoms network serving isolated areas of emerging markets. EMC provides global satellite communication using a high quality, fully managed network. The Company began its activities in 2002.

Improve productivity through connectivity: The impact of increased and affordable access to communications and data services is widely acknowledged, with far reaching benefits in terms of private and public sector productivity, including market information, education, tele-medicine and extending financial services to the frontier. Increased coverage: EMC has the capacity to deliver fully managed, end-to-end solutions in difficult countries and regions where satellite technology is the best or only alternative. Broader range of services: Further to basic data and voice, EMC can support more sophisticated applications, processes and corporate software solutions such as SAP and Oracle. Enhance competition: Often, EMC is the only viable alternative to the incumbent telecomsoperator. Supporting EMC helps increase competition and provides comfort to many f its customers that sensitive communications will be handled with privacy. Reduction in travel/carbon footprint: EMCs Video-on-Demand solution to be deployed in 2011 will allow customers to collaborate with their colleagues, clients and suppliers without the need to physically travel in and out of remote locations. Vulnerable ultimate beneficiaries: Clients in main vertical (development agencies / NGOs, accounting for 54% of revenues), directly target the base of pyramid, especially in Africa. These institutions reach would be limited without the services of specialized niche providers such as EMC. Quick deployments: EMC has a custom-designed solution allowing fast, tactical implementation of communications links following natural catastrophes (i.e., most recently in the Haiti and Chile earthquakes). EMC''s personnel, a team of highly trained and experienced professionals, is available and ready to deploy and implement satellite services within 48 hours thanks to a stock of pre-staged equipment at regional offices across all continents. Business continuity: Strategically located infrastructure ensures business continuity / disaster recovery through redundant links and ample data center capacity. Remaining operational during a disaster makes the difference between financial sustainability and extensive losses for any public or private corporation.

name.narrative: EMC has a network of strategically located, wholly-owned support centers (mainly in Argentina and Kenya) and approximately 700 customer sites scattered throughout the World. It operates 3 teleport facilities (located in Germany, UK and Hawaii), as well as 120,000 sq feet of secure disaster recovery/business continuity data center infrastructure. EMC has ample C-band spectrum (approximately 1,100 MHz) at below current market cost. Satellite capacity is a scarce resource for the medium term, thus acting as a barrier to entry.
